p: Following the identification of COVID-19, the WHO published a list of protocols used by public health and specialist research labs for identification of SARS-CoV-2 [ 85]. In addition, also due to shortcomings of RT-PCR approach to detect SARS-CoV-2, the serum immunoglobulin (Ig) anti-SARS-CoV-2 type M (IgM)/IgG antibody detection against the SARS-CoV-2 internal nucleoprotein (NP) and surface spike protein receptor-binding domain (RBD) may be used in diagnosis of COVID-19 and to monitor the disease stages and identify past infection and immunity [ 83, 86].
